name: Higaisa
descr: [Higaisa](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0126) is a threat group suspected to have South Korean origins. [Higaisa](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0126) has targeted government, public, and trade organizations in North Korea; however, they have also carried out attacks in China, Japan, Russia, Poland, and other nations. [Higaisa](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0126) was first disclosed in early 2019 but is assessed to have operated as early as 2009.(Citation: Malwarebytes Higaisa 2020)(Citation: Zscaler Higaisa 2020)(Citation: PTSecurity Higaisa 2020)

subtechniques.name: Web Protocols
subtechniques.descr: [Higaisa](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0126) used HTTP and HTTPS to send data back to its C2 server.(Citation: Malwarebytes Higaisa 2020)(Citation: Zscaler Higaisa 2020)

subtechniques.name: Registry Run Keys / Startup Folder
subtechniques.descr: [Higaisa](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0126) added a spoofed binary to the start-up folder for persistence.(Citation: Malwarebytes Higaisa 2020)(Citation: Zscaler Higaisa 2020)

subtechniques.name: Windows Command Shell
subtechniques.descr: [Higaisa](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0126) used cmd.exe for execution.(Citation: Malwarebytes Higaisa 2020)(Citation: Zscaler Higaisa 2020)(Citation: PTSecurity Higaisa 2020)

subtechniques.name: Visual Basic
subtechniques.descr: [Higaisa](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0126) has used VBScript code on the victim's machine.(Citation: PTSecurity Higaisa 2020)

subtechniques.name: JavaScript
subtechniques.descr: [Higaisa](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0126) used JavaScript to execute additional files.(Citation: Malwarebytes Higaisa 2020)(Citation: Zscaler Higaisa 2020)(Citation: PTSecurity Higaisa 2020)

subtechniques.name: Protocol or Service Impersonation
subtechniques.descr: [Higaisa](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0126) used a FakeTLS session for C2 communications.(Citation: Zscaler Higaisa 2020)

technique_table_data.name: Deobfuscate/Decode Files or Information
technique_table_data.descr: [Higaisa](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0126) used certutil to decode Base64 binaries at runtime and a 16-byte XOR key to decrypt data.(Citation: Malwarebytes Higaisa 2020)(Citation: Zscaler Higaisa 2020)

subtechniques.name: Symmetric Cryptography
subtechniques.descr: [Higaisa](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0126) used AES-128 to encrypt C2 traffic.(Citation: Zscaler Higaisa 2020)

technique_table_data.name: Exfiltration Over C2 Channel
technique_table_data.descr: [Higaisa](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0126) exfiltrated data over its C2 channel.(Citation: Zscaler Higaisa 2020)

technique_table_data.name: Exploitation for Client Execution
technique_table_data.descr: [Higaisa](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0126) has exploited CVE-2018-0798 for execution.(Citation: PTSecurity Higaisa 2020)

subtechniques.name: Hidden Window
subtechniques.descr: [Higaisa](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0126) used a payload that creates a hidden window.(Citation: PTSecurity Higaisa 2020)

subtechniques.name: DLL
subtechniques.descr: [Higaisa](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0126)’s JavaScript file used a legitimate Microsoft Office 2007 package to side-load the OINFO12.OCX dynamic link library.(Citation: PTSecurity Higaisa 2020)

subtechniques.name: Masquerade Task or Service
subtechniques.descr: [Higaisa](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0126) named a shellcode loader binary svchast.exe to spoof the legitimate svchost.exe.(Citation: Malwarebytes Higaisa 2020)(Citation: Zscaler Higaisa 2020)

technique_table_data.name: Native API
technique_table_data.descr: [Higaisa](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0126) has called various native OS APIs.(Citation: Zscaler Higaisa 2020)

subtechniques.name: Binary Padding
subtechniques.descr: [Higaisa](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0126) performed padding with null bytes before calculating its hash.(Citation: Zscaler Higaisa 2020)

subtechniques.name: Encrypted/Encoded File
subtechniques.descr: [Higaisa](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0126) used Base64 encoded compressed payloads.(Citation: Malwarebytes Higaisa 2020)(Citation: Zscaler Higaisa 2020)

subtechniques.name: Compression
subtechniques.descr: [Higaisa](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0126) used Base64 encoded compressed payloads.(Citation: Malwarebytes Higaisa 2020)(Citation: Zscaler Higaisa 2020)

subtechniques.name: Spearphishing Attachment
subtechniques.descr: [Higaisa](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0126) has sent spearphishing emails containing malicious attachments.(Citation: Malwarebytes Higaisa 2020)(Citation: Zscaler Higaisa 2020)

technique_table_data.name: Process Discovery
technique_table_data.descr: [Higaisa](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0126)’s shellcode attempted to find the process ID of the current process.(Citation: Zscaler Higaisa 2020)

subtechniques.name: Internal Proxy
subtechniques.descr: [Higaisa](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0126) discovered system proxy settings and used them if available.(Citation: Zscaler Higaisa 2020)

subtechniques.name: Scheduled Task
subtechniques.descr: [Higaisa](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0126) dropped and added officeupdate.exe to scheduled tasks.(Citation: Malwarebytes Higaisa 2020)(Citation: Zscaler Higaisa 2020)

technique_table_data.name: Scheduled Transfer
technique_table_data.descr: [Higaisa](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0126) sent the victim computer identifier in a User-Agent string back to the C2 server every 10 minutes.(Citation: PTSecurity Higaisa 2020)

technique_table_data.name: System Information Discovery
technique_table_data.descr: [Higaisa](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0126) collected the system volume serial number, GUID, and computer name.(Citation: PTSecurity Higaisa 2020)(Citation: Malwarebytes Higaisa 2020)

technique_table_data.name: System Network Configuration Discovery
technique_table_data.descr: [Higaisa](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0126) used ipconfig to gather network configuration information.(Citation: Malwarebytes Higaisa 2020)(Citation: Zscaler Higaisa 2020)

technique_table_data.name: System Time Discovery
technique_table_data.descr: [Higaisa](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0126) used a function to gather the current time.(Citation: Zscaler Higaisa 2020)

subtechniques.name: Malicious File
subtechniques.descr: [Higaisa](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0126) used malicious e-mail attachments to lure victims into executing LNK files.(Citation: Malwarebytes Higaisa 2020)(Citation: Zscaler Higaisa 2020)

technique_table_data.name: XSL Script Processing
technique_table_data.descr: [Higaisa](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0126) used an XSL file to run VBScript code.(Citation: PTSecurity Higaisa 2020)

techniques.name: Masquerading
techniques.sub_name: Match Legitimate Resource Name or Location

Malwarebytes Higaisa 2020.description: Malwarebytes Threat Intelligence Team. (2020, June 4). New LNK attack tied to Higaisa APT discovered. Retrieved March 2, 2021.

PTSecurity Higaisa 2020.description: PT ESC Threat Intelligence. (2020, June 4). COVID-19 and New Year greetings: an investigation into the tools and methods used by the Higaisa group. Retrieved March 2, 2021.

Zscaler Higaisa 2020.description: Singh, S. Singh, A. (2020, June 11). The Return on the Higaisa APT. Retrieved March 2, 2021.
